definition: gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody
festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]
see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]

sentences.english: Because the air is so cold and thin, the cabin has to be air-conditioned.
sentences.chinese: 由於空氣又冷又稀薄客艙必須進行空氣調節。

sentences.english: The air-conditioning system maintains a uniform temperature throughout the building.
sentences.chinese: 空氣調節系統使整座建築物保持恆溫。

sentences.english: In the basement there is also a central air-conditioning for the whole building.
sentences.chinese: 地下室有一箇中央空調爲整個建築提供空氣調節。
